turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Oh well he must be a surfer.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Shutup, you might learn somethin' you're not careful... So last year Nixon scuffs a counter going over. There was a soil sample.  Non- specific mud traces of asphalt, oils, blah, blah... sand and... carnuba wax.  So I became a wax expert.  There's 80 some uses for this stuff, something like five hundred products.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Candle wax.  Car wax.  Mustache wax? Could be anything.  Guy's waxing his mustache at the beach.  Gets sand in it.  Wipes it off with a shoe.  Shoe scuffs the counter.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: The lab made three possible matches, this was one of 'em.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Sex wax?  You're not into kinky shit, are you Angelo?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Surfers use it on their boards. They rub sand into it for traction.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Thanks for the tip.  I needed this knowledge.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: ... Four months.  June to October. Mmmm...same the year before.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Another month and we don't see 'em again 'til next summer.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Johnny, it's the only way.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Why can't I just walk around with this thing under my arm and act stoned?  Ask a few questions.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: They're like some kind of tribe. Got their own language.  You can't just walk up to these guys.  You've got to get out there.  Learn some moves.  Get into their head.  Pick up the speech.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Angelo, this stuff is for little rubber people who don't shave yet.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: It's all balance, right?  And coordination.  How hard can it be?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: I think you gotta hit them straight on!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Got it...

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: What, you couldn't have just left the thing in your car?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: It sticks out, so I can't lock it. Look, Angelo, you think I joined the FBI to learn to surf?  This was your lame-o idea in the first place.  You gotta back me up on this.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Johnny, all I can say is we better come up with something real soon.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Angelo, pay attention.  There's gonna be a test afterward.  Lab is showing traces of toxins.  PCBs. Heavy elements... selenium, titanium and arsenic.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Guy's the Toxic Avenger.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: The beaches are always being closed because of waste spills, right?  And surfers are territorial.  They stick mostly to certain breaks.  If we can get some hair samples, and get a match to a certain beach, we'd know which break the Ex-Presidents surf. You buyin' this?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: No.  But let's do it, anyway.  It's gonna bug the shit out of Harp.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Big zippo so far.  How about you?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Patience hotshot.  Patience.  It'll be subtle, if it's here at all.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: No, but there are four guys back there you might check out.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Thanks, buddy.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Look, if you're gonna go leavin' your piece and your shield in the car, you can damn well stay in sight.  Okay?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Okay, Dad.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: ... Felony B and E, three months in juvey.  Better.  Felony assault. Postgraduate work at Chino. Excellent.  I'm lovin' it.  What about the brother?  Great!  Another model citizen. These guys really fit the profile.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Remember, all bank robbers are losers, but not all losers are bank robbers.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: When did Harp say they'd have the warrant?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: He's pushing it through first thing. You better get some sleep tonight, it could be an interesting morning.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Did that worthless punk partner of mine ever show up?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Right here, partner.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I'm ready to rock, Angelo.  Where you want me?

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Cole and Munoz are going in the back door.  Babbit is backing me.  So I want you at the side window by the hedge.  You're strictly backup, got it?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Got it.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Awright.  Get into position.  I'm rolling.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Aw shit.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Nice tattoo, Dietz.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Johnny!  Uh, you, uh... should call first, you know?  Hey, where the hell were you all day?  You gotta at least call in or something.  You okay?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Angelo, we gotta talk.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: ... so I started tailing him.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: This Zen master surfer.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Bodhi, yeah.  I'm on him all day, right.  He goes here, he goes there, he goes to Tower Records and buys come CDs, he has lunch at Patrick's Road House...  ... he goes into the Assured Trust Savings and Loan.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Did he rob it?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Cute.  He was inside for about 20 minutes.  The other guy, Roach, waited in the truck.  They were scoping it out, right?!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Yeah, or cashing a check.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Wait, wait.  Then these guys go back to their beach house and box up all their shit.  Load it in Bodhi's truck and take it to a public storage unit.  You see?  Summer's almost over.  They're splitting. They're gonna pick up a little traveling money tomorrow.  The next day at the outside latest.  I got a feeling.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Last time you got a feeling I had to kill a man, which I always hate because it looks bad on the report.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Angelo... I'm right this time.  We can still win this one.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: They're on their way to Maui.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: No way.  Not yet.  Come on.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I say we call it in.  Get some backup.  But you gotta do it.  Harp won't listen to me.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Sure.  No problem.  I'll just call up and tell him his favorite agent saw this one surfer moon another surfer yesterday and it looked real suspicious.  Shit, he'll probably call out the National Guard.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I say we don't call it in.  Under no circumstance are we to call this in.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Look, we handle it ourselves, for right now, okay?  We cover the bank, whatever.  You and me.  That way if nothing happens, or more accurately, when nothing happens... I don't get my tits any further into the wringer than they already are.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Time for lunch.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Angelo, it's eleven thirty.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: That place up the street has meatball sandwiches.  Get me two.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: The hell are they?!

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: They took a left at the next light!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: You sure?!

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Nothing?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I know where they're going.

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Figured you did.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Angelo!  Don't fire!

turns.speaker: PAPPAS
turns.text: Kid, get outta the way!!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: NOOO!!

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Shrimp and fries.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I mean, what do you want?  What are you doing hanging around here.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I need you to teach me.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Gimme a break.  One shrimp and fries to go!  Anything to drink?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I'm serious.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I can see that.  But forget it. Stick to tennis, or whatever you're good at.  Miniature golf.  Here, your number's 37.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Well, I'm just gonna go back out there till I catch on to it or break my neck.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: What is it?  You all of a sudden got this bug you had to go surfing? This is a line, right?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: No, no.  See, all my life I've done things for other people.  In high school I played football because my old man expected me to.  Then my parents always figured I'd go to law school, so I did.  Football scholarship.  Graduated Phi Beta Kappa--

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: This gonna take long?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Wait, so I'm a big hero to my folks, right?  But two years ago they got killed in a car wreck and I just suddenly realized all my goals had been their goals.  And I hadn't been living my own life.  So I wanted something for myself.  Something that maybe didn't make any sense.  You know what I mean?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I came out here from Ohio a month ago.  Never saw the ocean before.  I didn't think it would effect me so much.  Like I'm drawn to it, or something.  I want to do what you do.  It's the truth.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Tomorrow, 6 AM.  Here.  If you're a minute late I'm gone.  And Stud... I didn't take you to raise.  I can show you a few things but after that you're on your own. That'll be four fifty.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Stop here.  Do you agree to do exactly what I say when I say it?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Nice place.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: He rents it for the summer.  Bodhi always gets some slick place and throws it open to every surf burnout around.  Most a these guys can't keep a job.  When the swell comes, they're gone, they have to ride.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Who's the girl?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Catch of the day.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Oh, oh.  That sounds personal.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: People are expendable to Bodhi.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Meaning you were expendable.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: We went out for about five minutes... which is four minutes longer than most of them.  But you can't hold it against him, he's... different.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Sure, he's "the Bodhisattva".

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Yeah, he thinks he's evolved to a higher plane of existence, or something.  Maybe he has.  You've seen him surf... that frenzy.  It seems like anger.  It's not.  It's the energy of lovemaking.  The sea is the woman in his life.  She's his only true lover.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Bunch of goddamn adrenaline junkies. I hope you're not buying into this banzai-bullshit like the rest of Bodhi's moonies.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: I've seen that kamikaze look, Johnny.  You've got it.  And Bodhi can smell it a mile away.  He'll take you to the edge... and past it.  Hey, Bodhi.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: What's goin' on?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Swell's here, Johnny.  Bodhi always knows.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I can barely do this in broad daylight.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Come on.  At least no one's gonna see how bad you are.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You had enough?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Yeah.  I just want to sit out here for a minute.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Look at you.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Well, usually you have this sort of intense scowl of concentration, like you're doing this for a school project or something... I don't know, like something's driving you.  See, it's gone.  If I didn't know better I'd say you looked almost happy.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I... I don't know.  I can't describe what I'm feeling.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You don't have to.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Those are cold.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Warm them up.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I... I gotta go.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Johnny... what's going on?  I don't get it... did I do something?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: No.  I'm sorry.  I have to go. I'll, uh... I'll call you later. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Ouch.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Betadyne doesn't hurt.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: You're kneeling on my hand.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: So what'd the other guy look like?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Never saw him, was your basic hit and run.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: But you look like you been in a train wreck, how'd he just drive away?

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Johnny -- you've been using me!  Your jacket's on the floor in the bathroom -- this goddamn thing's half out of the pocket... Oh God, it's all part of some case, isn't it?

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Tyler, put the gun down.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You tell me the fucking truth Johnny... did your parents really die in a car crash?  DID THEY?!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I work bank robbery.  Guys I'm after are surfers.  I needed you, at first, but not--

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Fuck you, Johnny Utah.  Fuck you!! Don't you have a soul?  Goddamn you to hell!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Well, I saw you and--

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Yeah, you saw me and you figured that if a mere girl can do it, a big strong stud like you shouldn't have any problem.  Right?!  Well you figured wrong, dork!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Hey!  Uh, how do I get back in?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Carefully, tough guy.  Very carefully.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: My name's Johnny Utah!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Who cares!

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: I'm telling you so when you look back on this moment, you can think... there was this guy named Utah and he was pretty much a dork but maybe not such a bad person and I let him drown in conditions he had no business being in whatsoever... when I could have easily helped him.

turns.speaker: UTAH
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Wait!  Jesus Christ!  You're fucking crazy, you know that? You go in there you're gonna eat it on the rocks.  Here, follow me.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Major, looks like there were ten, maybe twelve guerrillas. Looks like they took some prisoners from the chopper.  Then a different set of track, over there.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Six others, U.S. issue jungle boots. They came in from the north, then followed the guerrillas.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Strange, Major. There was a firefight. Shooting in all directions.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: I can't believe Jim Hopper walked into an ambush.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I don't believe he did, Sir. I couldn't find a single track. Just doesn't make sense.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What about the rest of Hopper's men?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Billy... What the hell's wrong with you?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Something... in the trees...

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You've been pushing too many Pencils, Dillon. Had enough?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: No way, old buddy.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You never did know when to quit.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: That piece of work you guys pulled off at the Berlin embassy last week was really something. Blew the entry points on three floors and neutralized the opposition in eight seconds flat. Beautiful.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Like the old days, Dillon.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Also heard that you passed on that little job in Libya.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Wasn't my style. We're a rescue unit, not assassins.  This must be good. Big shot from the CIA, leaves his desk to come back to the bush. What's so important?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Those cabinet members are very important to our scope of operations in this part of the world. They're about to get squeezed. We can't let that happen. I needed someone who could get the job done, quick and quiet... no screw-ups. I needed the best. The best. So, I pulled a few strings at the State Department... and here we are.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Go on.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Our rendezvous points and radio freqs. are indicated and fixed. AWACS contact on four hour intervals.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Who's our back-up on this?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: No such thing, old buddy. It's a one way ticket. Once we cross that border, we're on our own.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: This gets better by the minute.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: You don't know how much I missed this, Dutch!!! Once you get this in your blood, you never get it out!!!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You never were all that smart... let's go!!!

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Billy's on it.  Heat seeker. Pretty sophisticated for half-asses mountain boys.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: They're getting better equipped every day.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Probably another rebel patrol. They operate in here all the time.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: I knew this man. Green Berets, out of Fort Bragg. What the hell were they doing in here? You got any answers for this, Dillon?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Jesus... this is inhuman.  Uh... I wasn't told of any operations in this area. They shouldn't have been here.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Well somebody sent them.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: It was all bullshit. All of it. From the start... you set us up, got us in here to do your dirty work.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: That's right, I set you up. You're a veteran at this, Dutch, I had to.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Why us?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Because I told you, you're the best. I knew you could do it but I couldn't get you in here without a cover story.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What story did you give to Davis?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: We've been lookin' for this place for months. The chopper must have gotten close when they got shot down. Hopper was sent in to get my men. He was just doing his job. When he disappeared I had to clean this up, I had to stop there bastards. We were so close, we couldn't quit. We couldn't sleep through this one. I needed you, Dutch, can't you see that?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: She's too valuable. She's got to know their whole network. The whole set up. We take her with us.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: We take her and she'll give away our position, every chance she gets. No prisoners, Dillon.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Blain...  ... Just like the others... no powder burns, no shrapnel.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: The wound all fused, cauterized... what the hell did this?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: We're still too far in, they won't risk coming in for us.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Expendable assets, Dillon. Seems Langley is never around when you need them.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: I can accept that, it comes with the job.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Bullshit. You're just like the rest of us.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: You're wastin' your time.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: No more games.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: We're going to need everyone.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: What are you talking about? We'll be out of here in ten minutes.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: We're not going.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: That rendezvous is ten maybe twelve miles, at most! We're almost home. But the chopper won't wait.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: He'll be looking for the trip wires. If we're lucky, he won't see this.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Now what, Dutch. You going to send your mystery guest an invitation?

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: No way, Dutch. I'm going. You get these people and get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: This isn't your style, Dillon.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Guess I've picked up some bad habits from you, Dutch. Now don't argue with me, you know I'm right. Get to that chopper and hold it for us. We'll be along.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You know you can't win this one.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: I'll see you there.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Right behind you.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Anytime.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't know, only saw one of 'em. Camouflaged. He was there...  ... Those fucking eyes...

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: What, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Those eyes... disappeared. But I know one thing, Major...  ... I drew down and fired right at it. Capped-off two hundred rounds and then the Mini-gun; the full pack. Nothin'... nothin' on this earth could have lived... not at that range.

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: Take a position over there. I'll work around towards you. When I flush him, you nail him...

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: ... Right, I got a score to settle for the Bro...

turns.speaker: DILLON
turns.text: We both got scores to settle.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Any sign of the hostages?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We found 'em both, dead. And the gear from the chopper. If they're Central American, I'm a fuckin' Chinaman. By the looks of 'em, I'd say our cabinet minister and his aide are CIA.  Another thing, Major, we were lucky... couple of those guys we waxed are Russians, military advisors by the look of it. Something big was about to happen here.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What's got Billy so spooked?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Can't say, Major... been squirrely all mornin'... fuckin' weird... sometimes I think that nose of his is too good... smells things that ain't there.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: You saw what?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I saw it.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Put him in his poncho and liner and carry him back. We'll bury him in the morning.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: I'll take him.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: We've got most of the flares, frags. and two claymores just outside. Nothin's comin' close to here without trippin' on somethin'.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Thank you, Sergeant.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: I'm sorry, Bull. It's never easy. He was a good soldier.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: The best friend I ever had.

turns.speaker: PHILIPS
turns.text: You're looking well, Dutch.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: It's been a long time, General.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: That's over the border, General.

turns.speaker: PHILIPS
turns.text: That's the problem. Apparently they strayed off course.  We're certain they've been captured by the guerrillas.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What have you got in mind, General.

turns.speaker: PHILIPS
turns.text: We figure we've got less than twenty-four hours to catch up with them. After that, there's not much hope. We want a rescue operation mounted tonight. That doesn't give you much time.

turns.speaker: PHILIPS
turns.text: You lift off in three hours.  There's one other thing.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What's that, General?

turns.speaker: PHILIPS
turns.text: Someone else will be going in with you.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Took 'em out with a heat seeker.

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: There's something else, Major...

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Mmmnnn...?

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: I don't think that was any ordinary army taxi...

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What's he got?

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: Same business, guerrillas hauling two guys from the chopper... followed by men with American equipment...

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: Major, you'd better take a look at this.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Hawkins?

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: I can't tell.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: What in God's name...?

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: I think it's Hawkins.

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: Where the hell is his body?

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: There's no sign of it.

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: How could anyone get through this, carry Blain out, right under our noses without leavin' a trace?

turns.speaker: SCHAEFER
turns.text: He knows our defenses.

turns.speaker: RAMIREZ
turns.text: Why didn't he try to kill one of us last night?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Georgia.

turns.speaker: BRIDGET
turns.text: No wonder.  For starts, you should know that hot pants are <u>horrid</u>, even when you do have the legs to carry them off.  What are your plans while you're in town?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Well... I might be going out to dinner.

turns.speaker: BRIDGET
turns.text: You'll want a cocktail dress then.  Turn.  You have a beautiful figure.  A little too out in the open but simply lovely.  Size six? Do you need shoes?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: I dunno.  Do thigh high, leather boots go with a cocktail dress?

turns.speaker: BRIDGET
turns.text: Philip!  We'll need shoes!

turns.speaker: BRIDGET
turns.text: Your uncle will like this.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: He's not really my uncle.

turns.speaker: BRIDGET
turns.text: They never are, dear.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Mr. Harris, we know you've purchased at least twenty percent of our stock.  We also know you plan to file a formal bid for a majority share.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Twenty-five percent.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: We're on the verge of closing a large navy contract.  Double is ridiculous but we can assure you a healthy profit on your shares.  We would give you a promissory note...

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You're not getting any navy contracts.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: There's no way you could know that.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: But I do know.  I also know your lines of credit are over-extended. If I don't buy your company, someone else will...  Ah, the escargot.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: We can reach an understanding on this.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I don't think so.  You should know we're going to fight you with every resource we have.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Do what you have to do.  I don't take it personally.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I do.  I take it all very personally.  Very nice meeting you, Vivian.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I like your hat.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Huh?  Oh... yeah.  S'okay?  Uhm... how're... business things going.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Let's not talk about it, it's too depressing.  Come on, I'll show you Thunder.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: Please, we hardly know each other.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Thunder's a horse.  Come on.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hey, big guy, you getting tired, yet?  I am.  This is Vivian.  You two been together long?  You and Edward?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: Hope to be?

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: It's... it's not like that.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I see.  Well.  Maybe that means you'd have lunch with me sometime then.

turns.speaker: VIVIAN
turns.text: You don't know anything about me.

turns.speaker: DAVID
turns.text: I'd like to find out.  You don't know anything about me either. That's why people have lunch.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What's that long building over there?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Storage, I think.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Not with those smokestacks it's not.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: The real estate possibilities are endless.  Most of the yard we'll just level.  I talked to a couple of developers, under the table, of course, and they said --

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: I talked to some developers about the land.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Congratulations, sir.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Mr. Kross is just getting off the phone with his stock broker. It's finished.  You've won.

turns.speaker: JAKE
turns.text: Who are you going after next, sir?

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: Who indeed...

turns.speaker: KROSS
turns.text: What would it take to buy our stock back?  Name your price.

turns.speaker: EDWARD
turns.text: To get me in a mood to sell -- double what I paid.  But your company doesn't have enough capital right now to buy anything.
